data.questionHtml:
Compare the following fractions by using the symbol > or < or =:
(i) 79 and 813
(ii) 119 and 59
(iii) 3741 and 1930
(iv) 1715 and 119105
data.solutionHtml:
First, we need to find the LCM of denominators in each case. After that, we will equate the denominators in order to compare the two fractions. 

(i) 
     LCM of 9 and 13 is 117.

     Now make both fraction equivalent with denominator as 11779=79×1313⇒79=91117813=813×99⇒813=72117we know91>72⇒91117>72117⇒79>813

(ii)

both fraction have same denominator as 9we know11>5⇒119>59
(iii)

LCM of 41 and 30 is 1230Now convert both fraction to their equivalent fractions with denominator as 12303741=3741×3030⇒3741=111012301930=1930×4141⇒1930=7791230we know1110>779⇒11101230>7791230⇒3741>1930

(iv)

LCM of 15 and 105 is 105.

Now convert fraction to its equivalent fractions with denominator as 1051715=1715×77⇒1715=119105

data.questionHtml:
Arrange the following fractions in ascending order:
(i) 38,56,6824,13
(ii) 43,38,612,516
data.solutionHtml:
(i)
LCM of the denominators 8, 6, 4 and 3 is 24.Now, convert all fractions into their equivalent fractions with denominator 24.38=38×33⇒38=92456=56×44⇒56=202468=68×33⇒68=182424=24×66⇒24=122413=13×88⇒13=824We know:8<9<12<18<20⇒824<924<1224<1824<2024⇒13<38<24<68<56
(ii)
LCM of the denominators 8, 12, 16 and 3 is 48.Now, convert all fractions into their equivalent fractions with denominator 48.43=43×1616⇒43=644838=38×66⇒38=1848612=612×44⇒612=2448516=516×33⇒516=1548we know15<18<24<64⇒1548<1848<2448<6448⇒516<38<612<43

data.questionHtml:
Arrange the following fractions in descending order:
(i) 45,710,1115,1720
(ii) 27,1135,914,1328
data.solutionHtml:
(i)
LCM of the denominators 5, 10, 15 and 20 is 60.Now, convert all fractions to their equivalent fractions with denominator 60.45=45×1212=4860710=710×66=42601115=1115×44=44601720=1720×33=5160We know:51>48>44>42⇒5160>4860>4460>4260⇒1720>45>1115>710

(ii)
LCM of the denominators 7, 35, 14 and 28 is 140.Now, convert all fractions to their equivalent fractions with denominator 140.27=27×2020=401401135=1135×44=44140914=914×1010=901401328=1328×55=65140We know:90>65>44>40⇒90140>65140>44140>40140⇒914>1328>1135>27

data.questionHtml:
Find the sum:

(ii) 434+925

data.solutionHtml:
(i)

58+310LCM of 8,10  is 40.⇒(5×5)+(3×4)40=3740
(ii)

434+925 or (4×4)+34+(9×5)+25⇒194+475LCM of 5,4 is 20.(19×5)+(47×4)20=28320
(iii)

56+3+34 LCM of 6,4 is 24.(5×4)+(3×24)+(3×6)24=11024
(iv)

235+4710+2415 or (2×5)+35+(4×10)+710+(2×15)+415⇒135+4710+3415LCM of 15,10 and 5 is 30.(13×6)+(47×3)+(34×2)30=28730

1324-716LCM of 24 and 16 is 48.(13×2)-(7×3)48=548

data.questionHtml: What should be added to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>5</mn><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>7</mn></mfrac></math> to get 12?
data.solutionHtml:
Let x be the required fraction.

According to the question:

x+537=12⇒x+(5×7)+37=12⇒x=12-387⇒x=(12×7)-(38×1)7⇔467

data.questionHtml: What should be added to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>5</mn><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>15</mn></mfrac></math> to get <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>12</mn><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>?</mo></math>
data.solutionHtml:
Let x be the required fraction.

According to the question:

x+5415=1235⇒x+(15×5)+415=(12×5)+35⇒x=635-7915LCM of 5 and 15 is 15.⇒x=(63×3)-(79×1)15⇔11015⇒x=11015⇔223

data.questionHtml: Suman studies for <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>5</mn><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> hours daily. She devotes <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math> hours of her time for Science and Mathematics. How much time does she devote for other subjects?
data.solutionHtml:
Suman studies for  523hours daily. Therefore, we have
523hours =(5×3)+23=173hours
She studies science and mathematics for  245hours. Therefore, we have
245hours=(2×5)+45=145hours
Time devoted to other subjects = Total study time - Time devoted to science and mathematics 

= 173-145=(17×5)-(14×3)15=4315hours

data.questionHtml: A piece of wire is of length <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>12</mn><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. If it is cut into two pieces in such a way that the length of one piece is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>5</mn><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo>,</mo></math> what is the length of the other piece?
data.solutionHtml:
Let the length of second piece be x.

Total length of wire = Length of one piece + Length of second piece

1234=514+x⇒(12×4)+34=(5×4)+14+x⇒x=(12×4)+34-(5×4)+14⇒x=514-214⇔304⇒x=304⇔152

data.questionHtml: A rectangular sheet of paper is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>12</mn><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo> </mo><mi>cm</mi></math> long and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>10</mn><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo> </mo><mi>cm</mi></math> wide. Find its perimeter.
data.solutionHtml:
Perimeter of rectangle = 2(length + width)

2×1212+1023=2×(12×2)+12+(10×3)+23=2×(25×3)+(32×2)6=2×1396=1393 cm

data.questionHtml: Shikha plants 5 saplings in a row in her garden. The distance between two adjacent saplings is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. Find the distance between the first and the last sapling.
data.solutionHtml:
Distance between the first and second saplings = 34m
Distance between the first and third saplings = 2×34m=32m
Distance between the first and fourth saplings = 3×34m=94m

Distance between the first and fifth saplings  = 4 × 34m=3 m

data.questionHtml: Lipika reads a book for <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>1</mn><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> hours everyday. She reads the entire book in 6 days. How many hours in all were required by her to read the book?
data.solutionHtml:
In one day, Lipika reads for 134hours.
134hours=(1×4)+34=74hours
Total hours required = 74×6=424hours = 212hours = 1012hours

data.questionHtml: If milk is available at Rs <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>17</mn><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> per litre, find the cost of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>7</mn><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math> litres of milk.
data.solutionHtml:
Cost of 1 litre milk = Rs. 1734
1734=(17×4)+34=714
⇒Cost of 1 litre milk =Rs. 714
725litres=(7×5)+25=375litresCost of 375litres milk = Cost of 1 litre milk × 375Cost of 375litres milk=714× 375=Rs. 262720= Rs. 131720

data.questionHtml: Sharda can walk <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>8</mn><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo> </mo><mi>km</mi></math> in one hour. How much distance will she cover in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math> hours?
data.solutionHtml:
813km=(8×3)+13⇒813km=253km

Distance covered by ​Sharda in 1 hour =  253km
225hours =(2×5)+25=125hours
Distance covered by Sharda in 125hours = Distance covered in 1 hour ×125
⇒Distance covered by Sharda in 125hours = 253×125=20 km

data.questionHtml:
Find the reciprocal of each of the following fractions and classify them as proper, improper and whole numbers:
(i) 37
(ii) 58
(iii) 97
(iv) 65
(v) 127
(vi) 18
data.solutionHtml:
Reciprocal of a non-zero fraction ab is ba

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If a fraction ab is a lowest terms, then HCF of a and b is

(a) a                                       (b) b                                       (c) 1                                       (d) ab
data.solutionHtml:
We know that a fraction is in its lowest terms if its numerator and denominator have no common factor other than 1.

Thus, if the fraction ab is in its lowest terms, then the HCF of a and b is 1.

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

The fraction 8498 in its lowest terms is

(a) 4249                                       (b) 1214                                       (c) 67                                       (d) 37
data.solutionHtml:
Factors of 84: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 12, 14, 21, 28, 42, 84

Factors of 98: 1, 2, 7, 14, 49, 98

Common factors of 84 and 98: 1, 2, 14

∴ HCF of 84 and 98 = 14

Now,

8498=84÷1498÷14=67             (Dividing numerator and denominator by the HCF of 84 and 98 i.e. 14)

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following fraction is an irreducible (or in its lowest terms)?

(a) 91104                                       (b) 105112                                       (c) 5185                                       (d) 4383
data.solutionHtml:
We know that a fraction is irreducible (or is in its lowest terms) if the HCF of its numerator and denominator is 1.

Consider the fraction 91104.

HCF of 91 and 104 = 13 ≠ 1

So, the fraction 91104 is reducible.

Consider the fraction 105112.

HCF of 105 and 112 = 7 ≠ 1

So, the fraction 105112 is reducible.

Consider the fraction 5185.

HCF of 51 and 85 = 17 ≠ 1

So, the fraction 5185 is reducible.

Now,

Consider the fraction 4383.

HCF of 43 and 83 = 1

So, the fraction 4383 is irreducible (or is in its lowest terms).

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following is a proper fraction?

(a) 1317                                       (b) 1713                                       (c) 125                                       (d) 134
data.solutionHtml:
A fraction whose numerator is less than the denominator is called a proper fraction.

The numerator in each of the fractions 1713, 125, 134=74 is more than the denominator, so these fractions are improper fractions.

The numerator of the fraction 1317 is less than the denominator, so this fraction is a proper fraction.

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

data.questionHtml:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following fractions is more than one-third?

(a) 2370                               (b) 205819                               (c) 2675                               (d) 118335
data.solutionHtml:
Let ab and cd be two fractions. Then, ab>cd if a×d>b×c.

Consider the fractions 2370 and 13.
23×3=691×70=70∴23×3<1×70⇒2370<13

Consider the fractions 205819 and 13.
205×3=6151×819=819∴205×3<1×819⇒205819<13

Consider the fractions 2675 and 13.
26×3=781×75=75∴26×3>1×75⇒2675>13

Consider the fractions 118335 and 13.
118×3=3541×335=335∴118×3>1×335⇒118335>13

Thus, the fractions 2675 and 118335 are more than the fraction 13.

Hence, the correct answers are options (c) and (d).
